label: Politics
description: Politics is obviously a common theme for inauguration speeches, but some subjects are specific for certain speeches:
insights: Although President of the United States has a low relative average search interest in 2016, President George H.W. Bush is the only one who mentions this subject.
The Republic itself is a relevant topic in early speeches, for President Washington and Jefferson.

label: Finance
description: During an inauguration speech presidents usually lay out their vision for finance and economics.
insights: During the Great Depression, it made sense to talk about actual money. President Roosevelt was the only one mentioning this subject.
Commerce is a subject that has a high search interest throughout the year.

label: Emotions & Human Traits
description: Discussing human emotions and human traits allow people to connect to contents of the speech on an emotional level.
insights: Courage is a subject mention mostly by President George W. Bush.
Compassion is a subject mentioned by President George W. Bush as well, suggesting his speech has to do with character.

label: Spirit & Mind
description: Many people live a spiritual or religious life. Presidents usually touch upon matters of the mind.
insights: In general God is a subject that often occurs in inauguration speeches, also in closing words.
Of all the selected subjects, God was the subject most mentioned by President Lincoln.

label: Society
description: Many subjects are covered in an inaugration speech regarding society
insights: Peace is a very popular subject. It's the most mentioned subject by Presidents Jefferson, Nixon and Reagan.
Although Political Freedom has not a very high search average in 2016, it is one of the most popular subjects in inauguration speeches.

label: Other
description: Several subjects have not been categorized in the other themes.
insights: President Nixon is the only one mentioning the subject Moon, which was relevant due to the first trip to the moon.
For most presidents the subject United States was the most popular subject mentioned.
